clean_content:
Definition / general

* Resembles carcinoma clinically* Presumed due to crush injury of tongue muscle

Terminology

* Also called ulcerative eosinophilic granuloma, Riga-Fede disease, traumatic granuloma

Case reports

* 6 month old boy with traumatic lingual ulceration ([Ital J Pediatr 2012;38:20](22621646))* 70 year old woman with Riga-Fede-like disease ([Indian J Dermatol 2010;55:92](20418986))

Clinical images

Images hosted on other servers:  

70 year old woman:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavitytongueeosinophiliaclinical1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2856382/figure/F0001/)

Painful ulcer of tongue

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavitytongueeosinophiliaclinical2.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2856382/figure/F0002/)

Ill fitting prosthesis

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavitytongueeosinophiliaclinical3.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2856382/figure/F0003/)

Healing after removal of prosthesis

6 month old boy:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavitytongueeosinophiliaclinical4.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3495853/figure/F1/)

Ulcerative swelling

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Eosinophils and other inflammatory cells in submucosa, mucosa, salivary glands* Dilated vessels often present

Microscopic (histologic) images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavitytongueeosinophiliamicro1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3495853/figure/F2/)

Mixed cellular infiltrate
